elements.content: A 2D noninterpenetrated flexible metal-organic porous solid, {[Cu2(cis-chdc)2(bpee)]·H2O} n (1) based on a paddle-wheel building unit has been constructed using a mixed-ligand system. Guest-induced irreversible internetwork displacements of the 2D grids result in permanent porosity in the framework, as realized by the selective CO2 sorption over N2. The different affinity and selectivity of the solvent molecules was correlated with the internal polarity of the pore surfaces.
elements.clean_text: A 2D noninterpenetrated flexible metal-organic porous solid, {[Cu2(cis-chdc)2(bpee)]⋅H2O} n  (1) based on a paddle-wheel building unit has been constructed using a mixed-ligand system. Guest-induced irreversible internetwork displacements of the 2D grids result in permanent porosity in the framework, as realized by the selective CO2 sorption over N2. The different affinity and selectivity of the solvent molecules was correlated with the internal polarity of the pore surfaces.

elements.content: A 2D noninterpenetrated porous solid, {[Cu2(cis-chdc)2(bpee)]·H2O} n , composed of a mixed-ligand system shows irreversible guest-induced structural transformation associated with the sliding of the 2D sheets and resulting permanent porosity in the framework. The polarity of the linkers has an effective impact over the affinity of guest accommodation.
elements.clean_text: A 2D noninterpenetrated porous solid, {[Cu2(cis-chdc)2(bpee)]⋅H2O} n , composed of a mixed-ligand system shows irreversible guest-induced structural transformation associated with the sliding of the 2D sheets and resulting permanent porosity in the framework. The polarity of the linkers has an effective impact over the affinity of guest accommodation.

elements.content: The flexible and dynamic porous frameworks have attracted current attention because of their advantages in selective sorption, separation, molecular recognition, and sensing properties. Guest-induced structural transformation, such as expansion and contraction in the frameworks, is ultimately realized by the pore deformation. This can be raised by several dynamic behaviors, like sliding motion between the networks, rotation or distortion of the organic linkers, or change in geometry around the metals ions. Inter-network displacement in the 2D sheets may lead to the permanent porosity and can allow the diffusion of oversized guest species. Moreover, porous solid with high thermal stability and different polarity of the pore surfaces will be useful for the separation of molecules based on their polarity. For this purpose, it is of significance to build a well-associated network using the mixed ligand system which facilitate the incorporation of functionality based on the chemical modification in the linkers. With the aim of studying the influence of organic linkers on the polarity of the pore surfaces, we decided to pursue the grafting of the 1,4-cyclohexanedicarboxylic acid (chdcH2) and bpee (1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethylene) in the Cu(II) system. The linker chdc have a constitutional flexibility with a hydrophobic backbone and hydrophilic dicarboxylate parts, whereas bpee can provide the environment of high π-electron density. The flexibility of the chdcH2 is associated with three possible conformations of two carboxylate groups, a,a-trans-, e,e-trans-, and a,e-cis-chdcH2. The e,e-trans form is thermodynamically more stable than the e,a-cis form and the a,a-trans form is least stable because of the 1,3-diaxial interaction. Here in this communication, we present synthesis, structural characterization and guest induced dynamic behavior of a 2D metal-organic network, {[Cu2(cis-chdc)2(bpee)]·H2O)} n (1) constructed using a mixed-ligand system (see Scheme ). The sorption studies of different gases and solvent molecules exhibit the selectivity of CO2 over N2, and the diffusion of solvent H2O, MeOH, CH3CN, and EtOH molecules into the pore surfaces, but not C6H6 molecules. Sorption selectivity and different affinities of the adsorbates were correlated by the size and polarity of the pore surfaces.
elements.clean_text: The flexible and dynamic porous frameworks have attracted current attention because of their advantages in selective sorption, separation, molecular recognition, and sensing properties. Guest-induced structural transformation, such as expansion and contraction in the frameworks, is ultimately realized by the pore deformation. This can be raised by several dynamic behaviors, like sliding motion between the networks, rotation or distortion of the organic linkers, or change in geometry around the metals ions. Inter-network displacement in the 2D sheets may lead to the permanent porosity and can allow the diffusion of oversized guest species. Moreover, porous solid with high thermal stability and different polarity of the pore surfaces will be useful for the separation of molecules based on their polarity. For this purpose, it is of significance to build a well-associated network using the mixed ligand system which facilitate the incorporation of functionality based on the chemical modification in the linkers. With the aim of studying the influence of organic linkers on the polarity of the pore surfaces, we decided to pursue the grafting of the 1,4-cyclohexanedicarboxylic acid (chdcH2) and bpee (1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethylene) in the Cu(II) system. The linker chdc have a constitutional flexibility with a hydrophobic backbone and hydrophilic dicarboxylate parts, whereas bpee can provide the environment of high π-electron density. The flexibility of the chdcH2 is associated with three possible conformations of two carboxylate groups, a,a-trans-, e,e-trans-, and a,e-cis-chdcH2. The e,e-trans form is thermodynamically more stable than the e,a-cis form and the a,a-trans form is least stable because of the 1,3-diaxial interaction. Here in this communication, we present synthesis, structural characterization and guest induced dynamic behavior of a 2D metal-organic network, {[Cu2(cis-chdc)2(bpee)]⋅H2O)} n  (1) constructed using a mixed-ligand system (see Scheme ). The sorption studies of different gases and solvent molecules exhibit the selectivity of CO2 over N2, and the diffusion of solvent H2O, MeOH, CH3CN, and EtOH molecules into the pore surfaces, but not C6H6 molecules. Sorption selectivity and different affinities of the adsorbates were correlated by the size and polarity of the pore surfaces.

<title>Guest induced sliding of the 2D rectangular grids toward structural expansion</title>
</caption>

elements.clean_text: 1  Guest induced sliding of the 2D rectangular grids toward structural expansion

elements.content: In a typical synthesis, the reaction of Cu(ClO4)2, Na2chdc (mixture of cis and trans isomer), and bpee in H2O-EtOH medium at room temperature results in green single crystals (see the ). IR spectrum (Figure S1) reveals the broad and intense band at ∼1608 cm−1 [νa(COO)] and 1419 cm−1 [νs(COO)], corroborating that all the oxygen atoms of the carboxylate group are involved in coordination with Cu(II). The peak around ∼3400 cm−1 indicates the presence of water molecules.
elements.clean_text: In a typical synthesis, the reaction of Cu(ClO4)2, Na2chdc (mixture of cis and trans isomer), and bpee in H2O-EtOH medium at room temperature results in green single crystals (see the ). IR spectrum (Figure S1) reveals the broad and intense band at ~1608 cm-1 [νa(COO)] and 1419 cm-1 [νs(COO)], corroborating that all the oxygen atoms of the carboxylate group are involved in coordination with Cu(II). The peak around ~3400 cm-1 indicates the presence of water molecules.

elements.content: (a) 2D rectangular grid of 1 composed of paddle-wheel Cu2(CO2)4 core connected by the cis-chdc2− and bpee; (b) 2D grid stacks parallel to a-axis forming 1D water filled channel.
elements.clean_text: 1  (a) 2D rectangular grid of 1 composed of paddle-wheel Cu2(CO2)4 core connected by the cis-chdc2- and bpee; (b) 2D grid stacks parallel to a-axis forming 1D water filled channel.

elements.content: Compound 1 crystallizes in triclinic P1̅ space group and structural determination reveals that a 2D rectangular grid of Cu(II) built up by the cis-chdc2− and bpee linkers (Figure a & S2). In 1, the paddle-wheel binuclear Cu2(CO2)4 units are linked by two chdc2− to form 1D chains that are further connected by bpee linkers resulting in a 2D rectangular grid like structure lying in the (022) plane. Each Cu(II) displays a slightly distorted octahedral geometry with equatorial Cu−O bond distances in the range of 1.965(4)−1.980(4) Å, which are comparable to similar-type of Cu2-dicarboxylate building unit. The axial positions are occupied by the bpee nitrogen (Cu1−N1 = 2.164(5) Å) and other symmetry related Cu(II) at 2.634 Å. The degrees of distortion from an ideal geometry are reflected in cisoid angles [88.62(17)−100.48(17)°] and transoid angles [167.32(18)−172.81(18)°] (see Table S1 in the ). The Cu···Cu separations in the 2D sheet along the Cu···bpee···Cu and Cu···chdc···Cu are 13.687 and 8.553 Å, respectively, and the effective grid dimension considering the van der Waals radii is about 11.0 × 5.5 Å2. It is worth mentioning that the adjacent sheets stack in a staggered ABAB manner in parallel to a-axis, forming 1D channels occupied by the water molecules (Figure b and S3). The 2D sheets are stabilized by π···π interactions between the pyridine rings of bpee linkers [the cg···cg (center of gravity of py) distance is 4.964(4) Å]. The staggered arrangements of the 2D grids drastically reduces the effective pore size to 5.50 × 2.75 Å2 and the rectangular pore surfaces is decorated by the hydrophobic chdc backbone and hydrophilic carboxylate and pyridine unit (see Figure S4 in the ). The effective solvent accessible void space was calculated using the PLATON and it shows 15.5% void space to the total crystal volume. Recently, Chen et al. have reported interpenetrated α-Po-type network, composed of Cu2(trans-chdc)2 paddle-wheel building blocks, which are pillared by bipy and bpee, respectively and interpenetration drastically reduces the void space. The cis conformation of the chdc in 1 results 1D chain of Cu2(chdc)2 instead of 2D square grid of Cu2(chdc)2 with trans conformation, which ultimately leads to the noninterpenetrated 2D porous structure.
elements.clean_text: Compound 1 crystallizes in triclinic P1̅ space group and structural determination reveals that a 2D rectangular grid of Cu(II) built up by the cis-chdc2- and bpee linkers (Figure a & S2). In 1, the paddle-wheel binuclear Cu2(CO2)4 units are linked by two chdc2- to form 1D chains that are further connected by bpee linkers resulting in a 2D rectangular grid like structure lying in the (022) plane. Each Cu(II) displays a slightly distorted octahedral geometry with equatorial Cu-O bond distances in the range of 1.965(4)-1.980(4) Å, which are comparable to similar-type of Cu2-dicarboxylate building unit. The axial positions are occupied by the bpee nitrogen (Cu1-N1 = 2.164(5) Å) and other symmetry related Cu(II) at 2.634 Å. The degrees of distortion from an ideal geometry are reflected in cisoid angles [88.62(17)-100.48(17)°] and transoid angles [167.32(18)-172.81(18)°] (see Table S1 in the ). The Cu⋅⋅⋅Cu separations in the 2D sheet along the Cu⋅⋅⋅bpee⋅⋅⋅Cu and Cu⋅⋅⋅chdc⋅⋅⋅Cu are 13.687 and 8.553 Å, respectively, and the effective grid dimension considering the van der Waals radii is about 11.0 × 5.5 Å2. It is worth mentioning that the adjacent sheets stack in a staggered ABAB manner in parallel to a-axis, forming 1D channels occupied by the water molecules (Figure b and S3). The 2D sheets are stabilized by π⋅⋅⋅π interactions between the pyridine rings of bpee linkers [the cg⋅⋅⋅cg (center of gravity of py) distance is 4.964(4) Å]. The staggered arrangements of the 2D grids drastically reduces the effective pore size to 5.50 × 2.75 Å2 and the rectangular pore surfaces is decorated by the hydrophobic chdc backbone and hydrophilic carboxylate and pyridine unit (see Figure S4 in the ). The effective solvent accessible void space was calculated using the PLATON and it shows 15.5% void space to the total crystal volume. Recently, Chen et al. have reported interpenetrated α-Po-type network, composed of Cu2(trans-chdc)2 paddle-wheel building blocks, which are pillared by bipy and bpee, respectively and interpenetration drastically reduces the void space. The cis conformation of the chdc in 1 results 1D chain of Cu2(chdc)2 instead of 2D square grid of Cu2(chdc)2 with trans conformation, which ultimately leads to the noninterpenetrated 2D porous structure.

elements.content: Thermogravimetric analysis of 1 shows a weight loss in the range of 30−95 °C, corresponding to the water guest molecules and the dehydrated framework (1′) is stable up to 260 °C (see Figure S5 in the ). The PXRD pattern of the dehydrated solid (1′) exhibits an intense peak at low angle around 2θ = 6.722° and other peaks remain almost the same, suggesting a structural transformation after dehydration (Figure c). The powder pattern was indexed and the cell parameters suggest that the a-axis expands (55.6%), keeping b- and c-axis almost the same (see the ) and showing a significant increase in cell volume (43.7%). During heating, the 2D sheet in the (022) plane at high temperature is expected to undergo a random shift in different directions. However, among different possible displacements, the most stable configuration must have the least degree of freedom. By analyzing the ambient temperature configuration of the sheets, we noticed that the puckered and flexible chdc ligand lies parallel to a-axis and rigid bpee ligand lies in the bc-plane and almost perpendicular to a-axis. The puckered conformation of chdc is not in the lowest energy. Thus, we concluded that b- or c-axis became rigid but the heating supplies energy to the chdc ligand to overcome the puckering force. Therefore, the least degree of freedom might be provided by the expansion of chdc along [100] direction to achieve lowest energy conformation. The (100) reflection in the low-angle area shows the conformation change of the chdc ligand which shifts the 2D sheets apart from one another resulting in an expansion of the overall framework.
elements.clean_text: Thermogravimetric analysis of 1 shows a weight loss in the range of 30-95 °C, corresponding to the water guest molecules and the dehydrated framework (1') is stable up to 260 °C (see Figure S5 in the ). The PXRD pattern of the dehydrated solid (1') exhibits an intense peak at low angle around 2θ = 6.722° and other peaks remain almost the same, suggesting a structural transformation after dehydration (Figure c). The powder pattern was indexed and the cell parameters suggest that the a-axis expands (55.6%), keeping b- and c-axis almost the same (see the ) and showing a significant increase in cell volume (43.7%). During heating, the 2D sheet in the (022) plane at high temperature is expected to undergo a random shift in different directions. However, among different possible displacements, the most stable configuration must have the least degree of freedom. By analyzing the ambient temperature configuration of the sheets, we noticed that the puckered and flexible chdc ligand lies parallel to a-axis and rigid bpee ligand lies in the bc-plane and almost perpendicular to a-axis. The puckered conformation of chdc is not in the lowest energy. Thus, we concluded that b- or c-axis became rigid but the heating supplies energy to the chdc ligand to overcome the puckering force. Therefore, the least degree of freedom might be provided by the expansion of chdc along [100] direction to achieve lowest energy conformation. The (100) reflection in the low-angle area shows the conformation change of the chdc ligand which shifts the 2D sheets apart from one another resulting in an expansion of the overall framework.

elements.content: PXRD pattern of 1 in different state. (a) simulated, (b) as-synthesized, (c) dehydrated at 130 °C, (d) H2O, (e) MeOH, (f) EtOH, (g) CH3CN vapor exposed for three days.
elements.clean_text: 2  PXRD pattern of 1 in different state. (a) simulated, (b) as-synthesized, (c) dehydrated at 130 °C, (d) H2O, (e) MeOH, (f) EtOH, (g) CH3CN vapor exposed for three days.

elements.content: The porosity of 1′ was examined by the gas sorption measurements. Upon heating the sample at 473 K, a CO2 (kinetic diameter, 3.4 Å) sorption isotherm run at 195 K, and observed rapid onset of CO2 sorption at very low pressure attributed to the microporosity of the compound (see Figure S6 in the ). A small hysteresis correlates a strong interaction of CO2 with the pore surface and Langmuir analysis gave a surface area of 168 m2/g. A N2 (kinetic diameter, 3.4 Å) sorption isotherm at 77 K shows no occlusion with type-II sorption behavior and results in a strikingly smaller surface area. This kind of selectivity results from the combination of stronger affinity of the CO2 for the host solid and also because of the critical difference in kinetic diameters relative to the pore size in 1′.
elements.clean_text: The porosity of 1' was examined by the gas sorption measurements. Upon heating the sample at 473 K, a CO2 (kinetic diameter, 3.4 Å) sorption isotherm run at 195 K, and observed rapid onset of CO2 sorption at very low pressure attributed to the microporosity of the compound (see Figure S6 in the ). A small hysteresis correlates a strong interaction of CO2 with the pore surface and Langmuir analysis gave a surface area of 168 m2/g. A N2 (kinetic diameter, 3.4 Å) sorption isotherm at 77 K shows no occlusion with type-II sorption behavior and results in a strikingly smaller surface area. This kind of selectivity results from the combination of stronger affinity of the CO2 for the host solid and also because of the critical difference in kinetic diameters relative to the pore size in 1'.

elements.content: We have also studied the adsorption properties with the different solvent vapors (H2O, CH3CN, EtOH, and C6H6 at 298 K and MeOH at 295 K) having different polarity to understand sorption selectivity and their affinity to the pore surfaces of 1′ (Figure ). The sorption profiles of H2O (kinetic diameter, 2.65 Å), MeOH (3.8 Å), CH3CN (4.0 Å), and EtOH (4.3 Å) reveal a type I curve with small hysteresis and sorption amount increases with increasing pressure. The calculations using the final sorption amount suggest an uptake of 1.5, 1.75. 1.3, and 1.0 molecule H2O, MeOH, CH3CN, and EtOH, respectively, per formula unit of 1′, which is consistent with the structural expansion. All the profiles were analyzed by the DR equation and the values of βE 0, which reflect adsorbate−adsorbent affinity, are 3.03 kJ/mol for H2O, 6.14 kJ/mol for MeOH, 2.15 kJ/mol for CH3CN and 9.40 kJ/mol for EtOH indicating that the affinity of 1 is much more to MeOH and EtOH compared to H2O and CH3CN. MeOH, CH3CN, and EtOH unveil steep uptake at low-pressure region compared to H2O. The careful observation of the channels environment in 1′ suggests that the hydrophobic −CH2 moieties of the chdc and −CHCH− of bpee would be exposed to the central region of the pore, whereas hydrophilic carboxylate part would be oriented to the corners of the rectangular pore. MeOH/CH3CN/EtOH molecule consisting of hydrophobic −CH3/−CH2CH3 part and hydrophilic −OH/CN part, feels ideal space for accommodation. The weak affinity of CH3CN compared to MeOH or EtOH was realized by the stronger polar character and hence can not interact effectively with chdc backbone. Moreover, this also explains the low uptake of smaller size H2O compared to MeOH. Consistent with the smaller pore size, 1′ completely excludes C6H6 (5.8 Å) molecules at 298 K (Figure e). The PXRD patterns of the vapor exposed state of 1′ reveal that (100) peak is shifted more toward low angles with increase in guest size (Figures and S7). This reflects the accommodation of the larger guest as the intersheet separation also increases.

The calculations using the final sorption amount suggest an uptake of 1.5, 1.75. 1.3, and 1.0 molecule H2O, MeOH, CH3CN, and EtOH, respectively, per formula unit of 1', which is consistent with the structural expansion. All the profiles were analyzed by the DR equation and the values of βE 0, which reflect adsorbate-adsorbent affinity, are 3.03 kJ/mol for H2O, 6.14 kJ/mol for MeOH, 2.15 kJ/mol for CH3CN and 9.40 kJ/mol for EtOH indicating that the affinity of 1 is much more to MeOH and EtOH compared to H2O and CH3CN. elements.content: Vapor sorption isotherm for 1′. (a) H2O (298 K); (b) MeOH (295 K); (c) CH3CN (298 K); (d) EtOH (298 K) and (e) benzene (298 K). P 0 is the saturated vapor pressure of the adsorbates at respective temperature (open symbol; adsorption and half filled symbol; desorption).
elements.clean_text: 3  Vapor sorption isotherm for 1'. (a) H2O (298 K); (b) MeOH (295 K); (c) CH3CN (298 K); (d) EtOH (298 K) and (e) benzene (298 K). P 0 is the saturated vapor pressure of the adsorbates at respective temperature (open symbol; adsorption and half filled symbol; desorption).

elements.content: In summary, we have synthesized a 2D network of Cu(II) using the mixed ligand system. The 2D network shows unprecedented guest induced irreversible sliding, resulting in a 1D channel structure with permanent porosity, realized by the selective sorption of CO2 over N2. The guest-accessibility of solvent vapors with different polarity has been demonstrated, which suggests a more hydrophobic nature of the pore surfaces. Structural flexibility results in regularity and selectivity in the framework with well-defined pore surfaces, which may find application in separation on the basis of polarity.
elements.clean_text: In summary, we have synthesized a 2D network of Cu(II) using the mixed ligand system. The 2D network shows unprecedented guest induced irreversible sliding, resulting in a 1D channel structure with permanent porosity, realized by the selective sorption of CO2 over N2. The guest-accessibility of solvent vapors with different polarity has been demonstrated, which suggests a more hydrophobic nature of the pore surfaces. Structural flexibility results in regularity and selectivity in the framework with well-defined pore surfaces, which may find application in separation on the basis of polarity.

cln_elements.clean_text: 1  Guest induced sliding of the 2D rectangular grids toward structural expansion

cln_elements.content: (a) 2D rectangular grid of 1 composed of paddle-wheel Cu2(CO2)4 core connected by the cis-chdc2− and bpee; (b) 2D grid stacks parallel to a-axis forming 1D water filled channel.
cln_elements.clean_text: 1  (a) 2D rectangular grid of 1 composed of paddle-wheel Cu2(CO2)4 core connected by the cis-chdc2- and bpee; (b) 2D grid stacks parallel to a-axis forming 1D water filled channel.

cln_elements.content: PXRD pattern of 1 in different state. (a) simulated, (b) as-synthesized, (c) dehydrated at 130 °C, (d) H2O, (e) MeOH, (f) EtOH, (g) CH3CN vapor exposed for three days.
cln_elements.clean_text: 2  PXRD pattern of 1 in different state. (a) simulated, (b) as-synthesized, (c) dehydrated at 130 °C, (d) H2O, (e) MeOH, (f) EtOH, (g) CH3CN vapor exposed for three days.

cln_elements.content: Vapor sorption isotherm for 1′. (a) H2O (298 K); (b) MeOH (295 K); (c) CH3CN (298 K); (d) EtOH (298 K) and (e) benzene (298 K). P 0 is the saturated vapor pressure of the adsorbates at respective temperature (open symbol; adsorption and half filled symbol; desorption).
cln_elements.clean_text: 3  Vapor sorption isotherm for 1'. (a) H2O (298 K); (b) MeOH (295 K); (c) CH3CN (298 K); (d) EtOH (298 K) and (e) benzene (298 K). P 0 is the saturated vapor pressure of the adsorbates at respective temperature (open symbol; adsorption and half filled symbol; desorption).

metadata.title: Guest-Induced Irreversible Sliding in a Flexible 2D Rectangular Grid with Selective Sorption Characteristics
